intro: Weinmannia camiguinensis, commonly known as the Camiguin weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as montane forests. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. This species is of particular interest due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
